case_vignette: A 25-year-old male presents with 6 months of discoloration in the underarms. He denies any blisters or erosions in the areas. He denies any history of diabetes, insulin resistance, or weight gain. He denies itch. He denies discoloration only with sweating. Physical examination reveals reddish-brown patches in the underarms; Wood's lamp reveals coral red fluorescence.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having this discoloration under my arms for about 6 months.
Have the discolored areas spread or changed since you first noticed them?
They haven't spread or changed; they've just stayed the same.
What is your age and gender?
I'm a 25-year-old male.
Do you have any associated symptoms like itching, pain, or odor in the affected area?
No, there's no itching, pain, or odor.
Do you have a family history of skin disorders or diabetes?
No, I don't have any family history of skin disorders or diabetes.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms anywhere else on your body?
No, I'm not experiencing any other symptoms on my body.
Have you used any new skin care products, detergents, or had friction in the underarm area before you noticed the discoloration?
No, I haven't used any new skin care products, detergents, or had friction in that area.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I don't have any other medical conditions and I'm not taking any medications.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight, either gain or loss, since the discoloration began?
No, I haven't had any weight gain or loss since the discoloration started.
Is the skin in the discolored area thickened or does it feel different in texture compared to unaffected skin?
No, the skin isn't thickened and it feels the same as the rest of my skin.
Final Diagnosis: Acanthosis Nigricans
